intro: Selago atherstonei, commonly known as the Atherstone's selago, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
